command: [withheld — non-actionable: would bind an IPv4 UDP socket to an APIPA/isolated adapter address and send base64-encoded chunks to a peer on an uncommon UDP port with low TTL]
explanation: Leverages a non-routed/alternate interface (APIPA) and UDP to move data out-of-band relative to the primary egress path, mapping to T1011.
rationale_steps: Select an alternate local interface distinct from the default route
Use IPv4 UDP with a constrained TTL
Chunk and send to a high, uncommon destination port
Ensure no global network settings are altered

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is withheld and described only conceptually, making it impossible to evaluate its syntax.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: While the described command attempts to implement exfiltration over an alternate network (T1011), it incorrectly uses APIPA addressing which is for local communication only and cannot reach external systems for true exfiltration.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The 'command' itself is literally withheld and provided as a meta-description rather than a runnable or parseable command string.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The explanation describes the command as moving data out-of-band, which is a technique for data exfiltration or command and control, entirely unrelated to MITRE ATT&CK T1011: Data Destruction.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: No executable command is provided—only a prose description—so it is not parseable or runnable as-is.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The described action is UDP-based data exfiltration via an alternate interface, which is not aligned with the provided Data Destruction technique description (mismatched with T1011).
